title: Marc Bolan-You Scare Me To Death-Vinylrip-320-Abrasax
description:
Vinylrip:
Marc Bolan - You Scare Me To Death 
Released: 1981 
Label:Cherry Red Records

Tracklist:
1. You scare me to Death 
2. You Got the Power 
3. Eastern Spell 
4. Charlie 
5. I&#039;m Weird 
6. Hippy Gumbo 
7. Mustang Ford 
8. Observations 
9. Jasmine &#039;49 
10. Cat Black 
11. Black and White Incident 
12. The Perfumed Garden of Gullliver Smith 
 
Backing Vocals - Dyan Birch (tracks: 1 to 12) , Frank Collins (tracks: 1 to 12) , Paddy McHugh* (tracks: 1 to 12) 
Bass - Brian Odgers (tracks: 1 to 12) 
Drums - Graham Jarvis (tracks: 1 to 12) 
Engineer - Peter Hughes (3) (tracks: 2 to 12) , Steve Pretage (tracks: 1) 
Engineer [De Lane Lea Studios] - Dave Siddle (tracks: 1 to 12) 
Engineer [Mixing] - Steve Pretage (tracks: 1 to 12) 
Guitar - Bernie Holland (tracks: 1 to 12) 
Piano - Graham Todd (tracks: 1 to 12) 
Producer, Edited By, Arranged By - Simon Napier-Bell (tracks: 1 to 12) 
Vocals, Acoustic Guitar, Written-By - Marc Bolan (tracks: 1 to 12)  
Notes: Originally released 1981 (after Bolan&#039;s death) on Cherry Red Records. 

Voice and acoustic guitar recorded 1966 at De Lane Lea Studios, Kingsway London. 
Instrumental recording made 1981 in The Town House, London (track 1) and at Radio Luxembourg Studios, London. 
Mixed at The Town House.
 
Simon Napier-Bell fills out many of the 1966-67 demos from the "Beginning of Doves" LP with backing music and vocals. The two new tracks are "You Scare Me to Death" and "I&#039;m Weird".

You Scare Me To Death was originally called Horrible Breath and was written as a proposed television jingle for Amplet tablets.
